title: Dave Coulier: Full House star diagnosed with tongue cancer
description: The 66-year-old had previously been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, a form of blood cancer.
content:
Actor Dave Coulier, who starred in the US TV sitcom Full House, has announced he has been diagnosed with tongue cancer.
It comes seven months after Coulier, 66, told fans he was cancer free, following his 2024 diagnosis of stage three non-Hodgkin Lym... [1673 chars]

title: Government delays Chinese 'super embassy' decision
description: There have been large-scale protests against the embassy over fears it will become a European spy hub for China.
content:
The UK government has again delayed its decision over whether to approve a Chinese "super embassy" in London until January.
A decision over the controversial plan close to the Tower of London will now take place on 20 January, instead of 10 December,... [3744 chars]

title: Trans girls banned from joining Girlguiding
description: Girls’ adventure charity says it made decision after seeking legal advice in wake of supreme court ruling on gender
content:
Trans girls will no longer be able to join Girlguiding, the organisation has announced, saying it has made the decision after seeking legal advice as a result of the supreme court ruling on gender earlier this year.
Girlguiding on Tuesday said: “Tran... [2517 chars]

title: Dell family to seed Trump accounts for kids with $250
description: The donation will help seed new Trump-branded investment accounts.
content:
Tech billionaire Michael Dell and his wife, Susan, have announced plans to donate $250 to 25 million children across the US.
The $6.25bn (£4.72bn) gift will bolster Trump-branded investment accounts, which were authorised by Congress as part of its t... [4493 chars]

title: Sister of Palestine Action-linked prison hunger striker says she fears for his life
description: Shahmina Alam urges ministers to engage with demands after Kamran Ahmed, who is awaiting trial, taken to hospital
content:
The sister of one of six Palestine Action-affiliated hunger strikers has said she fears every conversation with him will be her last and that ministers are waiting for them all to be hospitalised or “even worse” before engaging with them.
